title: EFM OAM INTERFACE CONFIGURATIONCOMMAND
description:
This command will allow the operator to enable/disable EFM OAM on the specified 
Ethernet-like interface and configure the mode, alive timer and response timer 
intervals. In addition also the internal traffic generator data applicable to 
this interface can be configured.
user_level:
The command can be accessed by operators with transport privileges, and 
executed by operators with transport privileges.
syntax: > configure efm-oam interface (interface) [ [ no ] admin-up ] [ [ no ] passive-mode ] [ no keep-alive-intvl | keep-alive-intvl <Ether::KeepAliveTimeTicks> ] [ no response-intvl | response-intvl <Ether::ResponseTimeTicks> ] [ data-length <Ether::TraffGenDataLengthType> ] [ bitrate <Ether::TraffGenBitRateType> ] [ smac <Ether::MacAddr> ] [ dmac <Ether::MacAddr> ]

resource_parameters.name: (interface)
resource_parameters.description: identification of EFM port / Ethernet port

command_parameters.name: [no] passive-mode
command_parameters.description: oam mode is passive optional parameter

command_parameters.name: [no] keep-alive-intvl
command_parameters.description: keep alive time interval optional parameter with default value: 300 - a timeout value expressed in seconds - unit: seconds - range: [1...300]

command_parameters.name: [no] response-intvl
command_parameters.description: variable response interval optional parameter with default value: 5 - a timeout value expressed in seconds - unit: seconds - range: [2...10]

command_parameters.name: data-length
command_parameters.description: Internal traffic generator data: Length of datafield, in bytes, of the to be generated test traffic. Must be a value from 1 up to 1500. obsolete parameter that will be ignored -  A value of 1 up to 1500. Indicates length in bytes. - unit: byte - range: [1...1500]

command_parameters.name: bitrate
command_parameters.description: Internal traffic generator data: Bitrate of the to b e generated test traffic. obsolete parameter that will be ignored

command_parameters.name: smac
command_parameters.description: Internal traffic generator data: source MAC address. obsolete parameter that will be ignored - mac address (aa:bb:cc:a1:02:03) - length: 6

command_parameters.name: dmac
command_parameters.description: Internal traffic generator data: destination MAC address. obsolete parameter that will be ignored - mac address (aa:bb:cc:a1:02:03) - length: 6 DS-LIN-TEST-01:automationuser>#

raw:
help configure efm-oam interface
EFM OAM INTERFACE CONFIGURATIONCOMMAND
======================================

Command Description
-------------------

This command will allow the operator to enable/disable EFM OAM on the specified 
Ethernet-like interface and configure the mode, alive timer and response timer 
intervals. In addition also the internal traffic generator data applicable to 
this interface can be configured.


User Level
----------

The command can be accessed by operators with transport privileges, and 
executed by operators with transport privileges.

Command Syntax
--------------

The command has the following syntax:
> configure efm-oam interface (interface) [ [ no ] admin-up ] [ [ no ] 
passive-mode ] [ no keep-alive-intvl | keep-alive-intvl 
<Ether::KeepAliveTimeTicks> ] [ no response-intvl | response-intvl 
<Ether::ResponseTimeTicks> ] [ data-length <Ether::TraffGenDataLengthType> ] [ 
bitrate <Ether::TraffGenBitRateType> ] [ smac <Ether::MacAddr> ] [ dmac 
<Ether::MacAddr> ]

Command Parameters
------------------

Table "Efm Oam Interface ConfigurationCommand" Resource Parameters

Resource Identifier        Description

(interface)                identification of EFM port / Ethernet port

Table "Efm Oam Interface ConfigurationCommand" Command Parameters

Parameter                  Description

[no] admin-up              enable efm oam
                           optional parameter

                           Parameter type: boolean
                           

[no] passive-mode          oam mode is passive
                           optional parameter

                           Parameter type: boolean
                           

[no] keep-alive-intvl      keep alive time interval
                           optional parameter with default value: 300

                           Parameter type: <Ether::KeepAliveTimeTicks>
                           Format:
                           - a timeout value expressed in seconds
                           - unit: seconds
                           - range: [1...300]

[no] response-intvl        variable response interval
                           optional parameter with default value: 5

                           Parameter type: <Ether::ResponseTimeTicks>
                           Format:
                           - a timeout value expressed in seconds
                           - unit: seconds
                           - range: [2...10]

data-length                 Internal traffic generator data: Length of 
datafield, in bytes, of the to be generated test traffic. Must be a value from 
1 up to 1500.
                           obsolete parameter that will be ignored

                           Parameter type: <Ether::TraffGenDataLengthType>
                           Format:
                           -  A value of 1 up to 1500. Indicates length in 
bytes. 
                           - unit: byte
                           - range: [1...1500]

bitrate                     Internal traffic generator data: Bitrate of the to b
e generated test traffic.
                           obsolete parameter that will be ignored

                           Parameter type: <Ether::TraffGenBitRateType>
                           Format:
                           ( 100k
                           | 1m
                           | 10m
                           | 100m
                           | 1g )
                           Possible values:
                           - 100k                  : bitrate = 100K bit/sec
                           - 1m                    : bitrate = 1M bit/sec
                           - 10m                   : bitrate = 10M bit/sec
                           - 100m                  : bitrate = 100M bit/sec
                           - 1g                    : bitrate = 1G bit/sec

smac                        Internal traffic generator data: source MAC address.
                           obsolete parameter that will be ignored

                           Parameter type: <Ether::MacAddr>
                           Format:
                           - mac address (aa:bb:cc:a1:02:03)
                           - length: 6 

dmac                        Internal traffic generator data: destination MAC 
address.
                           obsolete parameter that will be ignored

                           Parameter type: <Ether::MacAddr>
                           Format:
                           - mac address (aa:bb:cc:a1:02:03)
                           - length: 6 


DS-LIN-TEST-01:automationuser># 

25/10/25 19:10:59 major alarm occurred for ip-addr 192.168.222.11  : Successful Management login, 8 , Username : automationuser , Type : CLI

DS-LIN-TEST-01:automationuser># 

25/10/25 19:10:59 major alarm cleared for ip-addr 192.168.222.11  : Successful Management login, TimeStamp : 25/10/25 19:10:46 , Username : automationuser , Type : CLI

DS-LIN-TEST-01:automationuser>#
